free: #e I come from Meixi tribe, Renai village. I'm now still living in Meixi tribe.
#c 我來自仁愛鄉的眉溪部落，而且現在還住在眉溪這裡。
#n Tongan及Bayke各為眉溪部落之族語名及日語名。
#e My name is Iwan Kumu.
#c 我的名字叫 Iwan Kumu。
#e As for my parents, my father is Temu Pidu, and my mother is Kumu Biyugu.
#c 至於我的父母呢，父親名叫Temu Pidu，母親名叫Kumu Biyugu。
#n IU12, 13, 14 de should be ge/de是ge。
#e In the past, (this is) about my mother's past experience.
#c 從前，就是有關我母親的過去。
#e At that time, I was in elementary school, and since I was little, I knew nothing.
#c 當時，我還在讀國小。因為我還小，什麼事都不懂。
#n ani maanu 任何東西/什麼都。
#n ceka指物體的中間點。ceka (na) elu "路中央"；ceka (na) ali "中午 (白晝的中間點)"。
#n ye一般為表"疑問"。此處為表說者的不確定性，譯為"可能"。
#e And my mother, maybe it was usually three o'clock in the morning, she would get up and make the "kong kong kong" sound.
#c 我的母親，應該是約凌晨三點鐘時，就會起床，並傳來「kong! kong! kong!」的聲音。
#n ceka指物體的中間點。ceka (na) elu "路中央"；ceka (na) ali "中午 (白晝的中間點)"。
#n ye一般為表"疑問"。此處為表說者的不確定性，譯為"可能"。
#e And my mother, maybe it was usually three o'clock in the morning, she would get up and make the "kong kong kong" sound.
#c 我的母親，應該是約凌晨三點鐘時，就會起床，並傳來「kong! kong! kong!」的聲音。
#e So I looked in the front, to find that my mother was weaving.
#c 於是我往前看，原來我母親在織布。
#n haan mu qmita "往前看"。
#n kela naq 兩字連用，表"原來"。kela naq isu "原來是你"
#e Next to her were (the other) women who were twisting the threads of ramie yarn.
#c 而且還有其他的婦女在我母親的旁邊捻著苧麻絲。
#e My mother weaved when she got up from bed.
#c 我的母親起床了就織布。
#n tutui 一般指"起身的動作"。此處為指"起床"。
#n deriq專指"房子的左右兩側"。亦可指"山腳下"。
#e And not long after (my mother got up), those (women) who lived behind and next to our house were all weaving.
#c 而且(媽媽起床後)過了不久，住在我們後面的，和隔壁的（女人們）就全部都在織布了。
#e Then all women were making the 'kong kong' sound at three o'clock in the morning.
#c 然後所有的婦女都在凌晨三點鐘傳來「kong! kong!」的聲音。
#e So I thought: "What are these elderly women doing?" I couldn't sleep.
#c 我便心想：「長者們在做什麼呀?」於是就沒有闔眼，睡不著了。
#e So I got up, went next to my mother, and said: "Mother, what are you doning?"
#c 於是我起床，走到我母親的旁邊，我問：「媽媽，妳在做什麼呀？」
#e My mother said, "I'm making clothings. I'm making clothings for you all."
#c 我母親這樣說：「我在織衣服，是給你們穿的。」
#n lukus "衣服"。plukus "穿"。plukusun=manu "你們要穿的"。
#e "We're running out of clothes!" she said.
#c 「沒有衣服啦！」她說。
#n se 為 si we [說 語助詞] 之連讀。
#n ooda 有"過程"、"歷程"、"事情"等意。
#e "I get up in the morning, because there are so many things to do, such as making quilts, and making the cloths for your clothings" said my mother.
#c 「我一早就起床，是因為織布的工作很多，像是製作棉被來蓋，和織布來做給你們穿的衣服啦！」我母親這樣說。
#e I said: "I see!", and could not continue sleeping, so I sat next to my mother.
#c 我說：「喔！」然後也睡不著了，所以就坐在我母親的旁邊。
#e My mother was weaving flower patterns in making large thick quilts.
#c 我母親正在織大花的粗線布料作床被。
#n pacang (或capang) 指"厚布"。通常布匹上會有toriq (祖靈的眼睛) 菱形圖案的紋路。
#c 我媽媽的手從右邊這邊
#n lmanu 一般指"採收"水果的動作。在專業織布中專指"挑線"的動作，即一上一下地穿過線條。唱傳統歌曲時臨時編詞的動作亦可稱lmamu。
#e My mother's hand moved from her right as she weaved the slower patterns, and passed through the threads upward and downword.
#c 我媽媽的手從右邊這邊開始，以挑花織法挑線，上下穿梭過線條。
#e "Iwan, come and learn!”, said my mother.
#c 我母親說：「Iwan，來學一下呀！」
#e My mother asked, “Why don't you sleep?”
#c 我媽媽問：「你怎麼不睡覺呢？」
#e I said: "OK."
#c 我說：「好啊！」
#n budi 可指"箭矢"或"弓箭整體"。在織布用語中專指挑線用的桿子。
#e So I took the weaving stick that my mother handed to me. As my mother passed her hands up and down through the threads, I learned.
#c 我拿著我母親給我的織布桿。看著媽媽用它上下穿梭於線中，於是我學習著。
#n lmamu 原意為 "挑選"、"摘(水果)"。此處為編織用語，專指針線上下穿梭貌，宜譯為"挑線"。
#e I started from the right, and passed through the threads. My mother also started from the right moving up and down across the threads. We came across each other in the middle (of the cloth).
#c 我就從我的右邊挑織編織，而我母親也正從右邊過來上下穿梭編織著，然後我們在（布匹的）中間相遇。
#e In this way, the area on the cloth that she had to go though became less. I helped a little!
#c 這樣子讓母親要編織的範圍減少了一些。我也幫了一點忙！
#e Because of this, I started to realize that our mother was so hard working. She weaves before dawn, and goes to work during the day, I thought.
#c 從那時候起，我心裡稍稍有這樣的想法，原來我的母親是這樣辛苦。我想：「尚未天亮就要織布，白天又要去工作。」
#e "She carries back all the yam leaves in the evening, coming home to feed the bips and the chickens, and she does the laudary at night" I thought
#c 「然後，黃昏又揹著地瓜葉回來養豬養雞，晚上回來還洗衣服。」我這樣想。
#n mahu 專指洗"衣物"。smino則指"洗菜"。trima專指"洗澡"，即洗"人的身體"。
#n ata 專指"兄長的妻子"(嫂嫂)；angu 為"弟媳"；ina "媳婦"。
#e I saw my mother, my sisters in law, my father, and my older siblings.
#c 我看到我的母親，我的嫂嫂們，我的父親，以及我的兄姊們。
#n qbsuran專指同輩中年紀較大的手足 (兄姊)。年紀較小的為swai (弟妹)。
#e So I saw my mother, my sister-in-law, my father, and my older brothers and sisters. All of them worked so hard.
#c 所以，我看著我的母親，和像是我的嫂嫂、我的父親和我的兄姊，全部的人都這麼辛勞的工作。
#e Life in the past was much harsher than life in the present. This is what I thought.
#c 以前的生活是比現在還要困苦許多。我是這麼想的。
#n 此處 s 應為 sa "說" 的縮減。
#e After I graduated from elementary school, my mother told me: "Listen, Iwan. The elderly people in the past wouldn't say 'Go learn dressmaking!' and send their kids to learn dressmaking."
#c 我國小畢業以後，我母親對我說：「Iwan，以前的長者呀，都不會說『去學裁縫！』然後吩咐小孩去做裁縫。」
#n bruru 專指"女用背簍"。
#e The elderly people in the past, they only knew about working and carrying baskets and woods.
#c 以前的長者，只知道工作、揹籃子、揹木材。
#n qhuni一般指"樹"。此處引申為"柴火"、"木材"。
#n 滿聰明的 想得比較遠
#e But my mother, she was so brilliant. "Iwan, you have graduated from elementary school. Go to the Wushe Agriculture School and learn how to do dressmaking!" she said.
#c 而我的母親呢，她真的很聰明。她說：「Iwan，你國小畢業了，就去霧社農業學校學一些裁縫吧！」
#n Nogio Gako (日語：農業學校) 當時全名為"霧社農業學校"。
#e This old lady is indeed very brilliant.
#c 這位老人家真是聰明。

#e The elderly people in the past wouldn't be like this. They would say "After graduation, don't do dressmaking, don't keep on studying." "You will take care of the other kids at home. We will go working" they'd say.
#c 以前的長輩不會像這樣。他們會說：「畢業之後，不要學裁縫，不要去上學。」長者們會說：「你要照顧小孩，我們要去耕作。」
#e But my mother was not like that. She tried her best to lead me.
#c 而我母親卻不是這樣的，她努力地引導我往前走。
#n smeelu 指"修路"，由 elu "路" 衍生而來。
#e She told me: "Go to Wushe Agriculture School and learn dressmaking."
#c 她告訴我：「去霧社農校讀書並學縫紉。」
#e I said, "Yes."
#c 我說：「好的」。
#e So after learning dressmaking in Wushe for six months, I went back home.
#c 所以在霧社上學學習縫紉六個月後，我就回家了。
#e And she told me: "Iwan, what you've learned is not enough yet. Go to Puli to learn western dressmaking and make clothings."
#c 我母親又對我說：「Iwan，你學的還不夠，你再去埔里學洋裁，裁縫衣服。」
#e So I went to Puli to learn more. Then I got to know a little more about dressmaking.
#c 所以我又到埔里學習，又學會了一些裁縫技巧了。
#n tnhiqan 詞根為 theyaq ，原意為"玩耍"、"陪伴"。此處作名詞用，表"同學"。
#e When we graduated in Puli, we had many classmates. There were the Southern Min people and also the Seediq people.
#c 我們在埔里畢業時，有很多的同學，有閩南人，也有賽德克族人。
#e As I came home, all the clothes that the church allocated to the tribe, the large ones and the small ones, were brought by people to my house.
#c 我回到家後，像是天主教的配給品衣物，大大小小他們都帶到我家裡來了。
#e They said: "Iwan Kumu can do dressmaking. Let's bring her all the clothes, the large ones given by the foreigners, and have them busheled!
#c 他們說：「Iwan Kumu會做裁縫。這些大件的外國人衣服我們都拿給他修改吧！」
#e Therefore, they brought all their clothes to me.
#c 他們於是帶著他們的衣服來了。
#n kn-kingal "一件件"。sk-kingal meyah "一個一個來"。pn-kingal "一個人一個"。s-kingali "一個一個拿！"。
#e One after another, I busheled the clothes, and was paid fifty dollars for each piece.
#c 我一件一件的修改。當時修改一件我收50元。
#e At that time, fifty dollars was quite a lot of money to us.
#c 當時我們說五十元是蠻大的數字。
#e My mother was very happy and she said, "It's good that I made you study. It's a valuable thing!" she said.
#c 我的母親非常高興，她說：「我讓你去讀書真是太好了，真是有價值！」
#e musa (r)seno 指"嫁人"(去丈夫那裏)；mangan (m)qedil 指"娶妻"(拿取太太)。
#e So via a matchmaker, I married to a Chinese person.
#c 所以我透過仲介，嫁給了外省人。
#e Then I returned to the tribe, asking my mother again about weaving. "Mother," I said, "please teach me how to weave!”
#c 然後我回到部落，再次請教我的母親。我說：「母親，教我如何織布吧！」
#e At that time, I was about fifteen or sixteen years old.
#c 當時我已經約十五、六歲了。
#e "Please teach me a little about weaving!" I said to her. So she taught me.
#c 我對著我的母親說：「請妳教我織布吧！」而她也教了我。
#e It was at that time that I started to have the aspiration for what I'm doing for work now.
#c 從那時候起，我對現在所從事的工作就有了想法。
#e All the ramies (used for weaving) were (grown) from (the seeds given by) other people.
#c 連苧麻呢，我全部是向別人要（種子）。
#n han 為 "ha-an [go-LF]" "去" 的縮減。
#e I grew ramie first, and then I twisted the threads, rolled them, coiled them, and then weaved.
#c 我先種植苧麻，接著我捻絲、轉軸、繞線、織布等。
#e Because of this, all my interests (in weaving) were aroused.
#c 就因為這樣，我所有的心（興趣）都上來了。
#n 此處 maha 為表 "大約" 的意思。與 動詞 maha (主焦.去) 及 助動詞 maha (助動詞.未來) 有所不同。
#e I've been making all kinds of clothings for about forty years, including our traditional clothings of the Tgdaya people.
#c 我製作各種衣服已經有四十年了，像我們德固達雅的傳統服裝。
#n 語音上 ncuin "有時候" 可能有兩種變體：uncuin 或是 nucuin。
#n mari 原意為"交易"之意思。受焦、處焦形式各為brigun、brigan。bbrigan "商品"；bbrigan sapah "店鋪/商店"。
#e Sometimes I would buy nylon threads for weaving, and I would use the Southern Min techniques to cut and make clothes.
#c 有時我織布，會去買一些尼龍線，用閩南人的織法，來剪裁縫製衣服。
#n nasi 為表"與事實相反"的條件詞，和 (對未來情況有所假設的) netun  有所區別。
#n nasi 後所接的動詞必須是詞根：nasi eyah/*meyah ka Dakis, maha malu "如果Dakis來了，就會很好"。
#e If it hadn't been that (little amount of money earned by weaving), it would have been a little tougher for me to help my husband raise our children.
#c 如果不是那樣一點（織布賺來的錢），我就很難幫助先生撫養孩子。
#e My husband also earned very little at that time.
#c 那時候我先生的薪資也很微薄。
#n naka 原意為指一假設情況中說者所預想的結果。如：asi su ka mbeyah muuyas, naka maha malu "你一定要努力讀書，才會有好的結果"。
#n naka 亦可用於表"必要性"以及"義務"。如：naka isu mosa "應該去的是你"。
#e If I hadn't helped a little, how would we have passed through the hard time?
#c 如果我沒有多幫忙一點的話，不知道我們當時會如何度過？
#e Now, I am already old.
#c 現在，我已經老了。
#e I had learned (the art of weaving) from my mother since I was sixteen years old, and now, I am already sixty-eight years old. I am old now, with my hair all becoming white.
#c 我從十六歲開始便向我母親學習（織布），到現在已經六十八歲了。我已經是個頭髮斑白的老年人了。
#e Many government authorities concerned, such as the Township Office and the County Government, are offering a lot of help to the aborigines.
#c 然後很多政府單位，像是鄉公所、縣政府等，都在幫忙原住民。
#e They said:“Revitalize your traditions! Revitalize the cultures of trap-hunting, weaving, and plant-growing.”
#c 都說「起來！發揚祖先的精神！要振興我們像陷獵、織布、種植等文化。」
#n tutui 原為"站起來"之意。此處引申為"振興"、"復興"之意。
#e The Township Office is also pushing forward (all the revitalization programs).
#c 鄉公所也如此大力推動（復興運動）。
#n r<m>igo 有"觀光"、"遊玩"、"旅行"、"走走看看"等語意。
#e Also, some university (students) came to my house to know something about my weaving techniques, the processes involved, and some sweing techiniques.
#c 另外，也有像大學（生）來我家，了解一些有關我的織布技巧、過程、和一些縫製的技巧等。
#e Many of my works are (displayed) in my house, too, and when people pass by, they would buy them.
#c 我在家也有（擺設了）很多我的作品，有人們經過的話，也都會購買。
#n an ta naq 為 ani ta naq 之縮減。為表達"即使/不論如何"之固定用法。
#n hbaro 專指"人很多"、"眾多"。egu 則泛指"物件很多"。
#e Even though some people are just looking, there are still many people, including Seediq and Southern Min ones, who would buy if they like the works after looking.
#c 就算有些人只是來逗留看看而已，也有很多的族人和閩南人，如果看了喜歡，就會買。
#e Today here we have the university professor of Southern Min origin, and also teacher Meiyu Huang.
#c 現在，這裡有從大學來的閩南籍的老師，還有黃美玉老師。
#e Then they said to me: "Tell us a little bit about your past experience."
#c 然後老師們對我說：「說一些你以前的經歷故事啊！」
#e Then I said "Sure!"
#c 我就說：「好啊！」
#e I then thought of my mother, and my past experience.
#c 我就想起了我的母親，想起我過去的經歷。
#n 我想，我看到我媽媽的照片
#e Whenever I see the pictures of my mother, I would say in my mind: "Mother, I miss you so much!"
#c 每當我看著我母親的相片時，我總會在心裡說：「媽媽，我好想念您！」
#e "If you hadn't helped me, I wouldn't have lived such a good life" I think.
#c 我心裡想著：「若不是您這麼幫助我，我的生活絕不會過得如此的好。」
#n knmalu 為"如此、這樣地好"之意。
#e "Thank you so much, mother," I said.
#c 我這麼說：「媽媽，真的謝謝你！」
#e I'd say so when I am alone at home, and even when I'm walking on the road.
#c 我也都這樣自個兒在家喃喃自語，即使走在路上也都這樣說。
#n utux原指"鬼神"，此處和rmengo "說" 連用，指"自言自語"。
#e I cry every time I think of my mother.
#c 我一想到我的母親，我就會哭。
#e I would say, "Mother, you are so great!"
#c 我都會說：「媽媽您真得好棒！」
#e "You had me go to school and learn western dressmaking, so I know how to weave and make clothes.”
#c 「您都讓我上學、也都讓我去學洋裁，讓我會剪裁衣服和織布。」
#n so "像" 有出現於句首並附著代名詞之用法：so=ku nii mekan ido 我吃飯是這樣吃的。
#e "If it hadn't been you, I would not have become like what I am now" I would say this to myself in my mind. I am truly thankful to my mother.
#c 「若不是您，我不會像現在這樣。」我是由衷地這麼想。我是真的非常感謝我的母親。
#e So these are what I want to say today.
#c 所以我今天要說的就這些了。
#e I want to thank the professor, who has come here, visited my house and said "Tell us a little bit about your past experience!"
#c 非常感謝老師們，來我家玩，並且對我說：「說一些妳過去的經歷吧！」
#e I'll just stop here.
#c 我就說到這裡吧。
#n 此句anaq有"僅僅"之意。表示"我的話就只有到這裡了"。
#e You will understand by yourselves what I think, and what I'm saying now.
#c 你們自己會了解我心裡的感受，也會了解我所說的話。
#e That's it. Thank you!
#c 就這樣了。謝謝！
